DOCS_modelChunk = [{"ty":"is","ibi":1,"s":"CLAUDE BALLARD, Chairman				 	 NATHAN WHITTLE 
MARIANNE KRAMER, Vice-Chairman 				 	 Superintendent/Principal
MELISSA DORAMUS 						 		 
BILL SIMON							 RANDY JEWETT
COURTNEY WILKINS					 Vice-Principal
WENDY STRICKLER, Clerk								 
Camas County Schools District No. 121 We educate. 
We engage. We empower. Inspiring every Musher to excel!

3/16/2020

Dear Camas Parents, Students, Staff, and Patrons,

The Camas Board of Trustees and Superintendent Nathan Whittle, after meeting earlier this evening, have determined that Camas County Schools will be closing. This action is being taken out of an abundance of caution, and in light of conflicting information regarding the best practices for schools during the CoVid 19 pandemic. We are sure that you have a number of questions and hope to address as many of those questions as possible via this email. Should you have questions that have not been answered below, please feel free to contact the school office at (208) 764-2472.

Updated 3/18/20:
For your convenience, the current daily update will be written in blue. All previous daily updates will remain under the “Updated:” heading but will be written in black. This will allow you to quickly access the new information while allowing you to refer to information previously released.

When does this school closure start and how long will it last?

Camas County Schools will be closed beginning Tuesday, March 17th, through Friday, April 10th. Students will return to school on Monday, April 13th. 

Will schools be open to pick up medicine, supplies, gym clothes or other items students left in their lockers? 

Yes. Parents and students can pick up desired items between 8 a.m. and 2 p.m. tomorrow, Tuesday, March 17th. We ask that people picking up items from the school leave directly after gathering their items. Please do not congregate on campus.

Busses will not be running on Tuesday, March 17th. If you cannot pick up your items during these times, please contact the school office so other arrangements can be made. 

My child(ren) typically eat breakfast and lunch at school. Does the school have any plans to feed students during the closure? If so, how will this happen? 
 
As you may remember, you received an invitation over the weekend to fill out a survey requesting various information, including whether you were requesting breakfast and/or lunch for your child(ren). We have compiled that information. Tomorrow, Tuesday, March 17th, there will be a “grab and go” sack breakfast/lunch for those students whose parents indicated the need for food service. Parents who would like to “grab and go” must be accompanied by their student(s). We are not allowed to give any parent the sack breakfast/lunch unless the child is present. These sack breakfast/lunch will be available between 8:00 - 8:15 a.m.

The school will deliver the sack breakfast/lunch to the identified students beginning April 2nd. More information as to how this will be accomplished will be coming soon.

Updated: 3/17/20

Camas Community Pantry, Inc. has generously partnered with Camas Schools to assist in the delivery of district-provided food for those students who need breakfast and lunch during the emergency closure. We cannot express the gratitude we feel for their willingness and generosity in providing this necessary service to those of our students who were identified as needing these services.

Students will be provided with sack breakfast/lunch at the Camas Community Pantry, Inc. between the hours of 8:00 am and 9:00 am on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday of this week (3/18, 3/19, 3/20) as well as on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday (3/30, 3/31, 4/1). Students who were identified as needing breakfast/lunch on the survey sent to parents on the weekend of March 14th may pick up their sack breakfast/lunch at Camas Community Pantry, Inc’s location at 519 1st Street West, Fairfield, ID. As with the sacks provided by the school, parents who would like to “grab and go” must be accompanied by their student(s). The child must sign that the breakfast/lunch was picked up. We are not allowed to give any parent the sack breakfast/lunch unless the child is present.

DOCS_modelChunk = [{"ty":"is","ibi":4271,"s":"
If food services were not requested for your child(ren) on the original survey but you have now determined that these services are necessary, please contact the school at (208) 764-2472 or by emailing Wendy Jewett at wjewett@camascountyschools.org . We are adamant that any child needing breakfast/lunch is provided with them. 


Will the Camas Schools be providing educational resources in the event of an extended closure?

We are working on plans for providing continued instruction in the event of an extended closure. However, this will not begin until after Spring Break. Teachers will be returning to school on Thursday, April 2nd, to plan and prepare. Your child(ren)’s teacher(s) will be contacting you individually to determine your child(ren)’s needs. More information will be coming soon. 

Clarified: 3/17/20

Student Assignments: It has become evident to us that our communication regarding student assignments was not as clear as we thought. 

March 17th - April 10th: Teachers will not be assigning work to students unless you have made specific arrangements with your child's teacher(s). The only exception is for those students who are currently enrolled in an IDLA class which has assignments due during the emergency closure window. If your child is one of the students enrolled in an IDLA course, please refer to the IDLA section under Updates.
April 2nd - April 10th: Teachers will begin to prepare lessons for remote learning in the event of an extended school closure and we are unable to return to school on April 13th. Should remote learning become a necessity, we want to provide the best instruction possible. In order to support Camas teachers in providing this instruction, adequate time and training is being provided.
Teachers will be contacting the parents of their students to clarify what is needed. If you have not heard from the teacher in whose class your child is enrolled by April 8th, please contact the teacher.
Updated: 3/17/20

IDLA: For those students who are currently enrolled in an IDLA course and for whom a need for devices or internet was indicated on the Extended School Closure Survey, devices are being issued to IDLA students only on Wednesday, March 18th, from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm at the school. Non-IDLA students requesting these devices will receive them on Monday, April 13th, only if an extended closure has been announced.

For those IDLA students who are currently enrolled in an IDLA course, and for whom a need for internet assistance was indicated on the Extended School Closure Survey, internet devices will be distributed as soon as those devices come in. These devices have been ordered. When those devices come in, you will receive additional information as to how and when they will be distributed. 

For any questions or concerns at the district level, please contact Janet Colter at jcolter@camascooountyschools.org. If you have technical questions regarding connectivity, please contact IDLA Tech Support at (208) 342-0207. For questions or concerns regarding individual IDLA courses or assignments, please contact the IDLA instructor for that class directly. 

Earlier today, Janet Colter received the following email statement from IDLA:

“Hi all!
Your staff and teachers at IDLA are aware that students may have limited access to the internet, devices, and other resources as our communities respond to COVID-19. To support students, we are removing all late work penalties from today forward. Students may turn in any late or missing assignment prior to the end of the course with no deduction for late submissions. When at all possible, please continue to stay on track with scheduled due dates. Please note that zeros will continue to be entered after due dates have passed, but as stated above, you will have until the end of the course to submit without penalty. If you have any questions, please let me know.
Sincerely,
Andrea Wells
-IDLA Communications System”
Updated: 3/18/20

Students enrolled in IDLA courses picked up their devices this morning.

DOCS_modelChunk = [{"ty":"is","ibi":8324,"s":"For any questions or concerns at the district level, please contact Janet Colter at jcolter@camascooountyschools.org. If you have technical questions regarding connectivity, please contact IDLA Tech Support at (208) 342-0207. For questions or concerns regarding individual IDLA courses or assignments, please contact the IDLA instructor for that class directly. 

Will athletic and extracurricular activities continue during the closure? 

While we understand the importance of athletics and extracurricular activities, the scope of this pandemic is such that student and community health is much more important.

All athletic and extracurricular activities scheduled during the school closure have been canceled! Additionally, the school will not be available for any community activity or gathering. This is to facilitate the sterilization of the physical plant, including the use of an ozone treatment. 

IHSAA, the athletic governing body for Camas athletics, announced today that all practices and events have been canceled until April 5th. Coaches will contact their athletes with activities and individualized workouts. 



In order to ensure that the sterilization of the school is facilitated in the most efficient manner, all school fobs will be deactivated and will not be reactivated for school staff until Thursday, April 2nd, and will be fully reactivated when school resumes. Only essential personnel, designated by the district, will be allowed in the building.


How will the school closure affect the required state testing?

As of Monday, March 16th, required state testing will take place as follows:

-SAT Day: The SAT, which was scheduled for Tuesday, April 14th, has been rescheduled for Tuesday, April 28th.

-Idaho Standards Achievement Tests (ISATs): The ISAT testing window opened today and will close on Friday, May 29th. Camas students were scheduled to begin these assessments on Monday, April 13th. The schedule will be “pushed back” to allow our students to return to their school routine before testing will begin. You will receive updated information as soon as possible.

-Idaho Reading Indicator (IRI): The spring testing window for the IRI opens on May 1st. As of this, time the IRI will be administered as stated in the District Assessment Calendar located on the District website. If this changes, you will be notified.

Will the days missed need to be made up?

We are not sure at this time. The state does have a waiver process that allows schools to request a waiver of the instructional hour requirement should it be necessary. While we don’t have a definitive answer at this time, it is probable that a waiver would be applied for and granted if the length of the emergency closure jeopardizes student credit hours.

The national and local CoVid 19 situation is very fluid and will continue to be for several weeks, if not months. As always, Camas’ leadership will strive to make the best decisions for our students and our community. We commit to being as transparent about our plans as possible and to communicate as fully and clearly as we are able. Continue to watch for additional emails as we update our plans.






 Additional Information: 

3/17/20

Facility Management: Jeff Roebuck, Cams County Schools’ Maintenance Director, has communicated that he and his crew will be sanitizing the busses and bus barn today and tomorrow (3/17 and 3/18). The interior of each bus will be cleaned with a topical spray. In order to ensure that the interior of the busses are completely sanitized, the bus doors will remain open during the ozone portion of the process.

Updated: 3/18/20

Communication:
From the District to the Stakeholders: We will be releasing updates, via email and posted on the Camas County School District website (https://www.camascountyschools.org/) as needed. Initially, the plan is to provide updates on a daily basis and hope to be updating you on a less frequent basis as the situation becomes more stable. Email updates will be sent out via School Messenger. Should the situation demand an urgent update, a call will be placed via School Messenger with the specific of the update. You should be receiving a call from the teacher(s) of the class(es) in which your child(ren) is enrolled no later than April 8th in the event that remote learning has been determined an appropriate course of action to clarify what is required.

DOCS_modelChunk = [{"ty":"is","ibi":12747,"s":"From the Stakeholders to the District: As stated previously, the only ones that will be in the school building are district-identified essential personnel. However, to ensure that there is a thorough sterilization of the facilities, even these employees will be prevented from entering the build on certain days. In the event you need to communicate with the school, you may do so in any one of several methods: 

-Via telephone: If your call is not answered, please leave a message and we will return your call at the earliest possible time. If you have not received a return call within two business days, please feel free to contact the school school again.

-Via email: Please feel free to email the person you wish to speak with. The “formula” for emailing Camas staff is the person's first initial and last name followed by @camascountyschools.org. Please notice that there is an “s” at the end of school. There is only one exception to this formula is our High School Social Sciences teacher, Chris Tompson. HIs email address is christhompson@camascountyschools.org. If you are unsure of the staff member’s name, please access the following link which will take you to the staff contact link (https://www.camascountyschools.org/parents/staff-directory). If you aren’t sure to whom you should direct your email, please email Wendy Strickler at wstrickler@camascountyschools.org. and she will forward your concerns to the appropriate staff member.

 Please understand that the School and District offices will be closed during Spring Break, March 21st through March 29th, and may not be available to respond to your communication.

Additional Information: 3/18/20

Facility Management: As of this morning, the bus barns have been sanitized and the maintenance department has begun sanitizing the main building. We ask that you continue to be respectful of the time and effort this team is investing in this process by abiding by the guidelines previously published during this Emergency Closure. If you have questions or concerns, please contact Jeff Roebuck directly.

School Counselor: In light of our current circumstances, here are a few tips to alleviate some of the stress and anxiety that ALL of us are feeling during this unparalleled time of uncertainty, change, and the ever-present unknown:

Recognize, and be aware of the fact, that as awkward as all this feels, it is normal to feel unsettled!
“Social Distancing” does not have to mean Social Isolation! Stay connected with trusted family and friends via methods the CDC has deemed appropriate. 
Control what you can; just for the present moments of time.
Slow down your stress reaction to the events you cannot control. Below are some suggestions for how you can alleviate stress: 
Practice wellness. 
Exercise, if you can. 
Deep Breathing
5-minute Meditations 
Daily reading of inspiration material 


Please reach out if you, or someone you know or love, is struggling with undue stress (defined as anxiety which interferes with everyday functioning) or chronic depression at this time. Feel free to email me at: jcolter@camascountyschools.org . Please leave your contact information and I will get back with you within 24 hours. 

Stay well. 



Sincerely,

Nathan Whittle

*
Superintendent/Principal
